member.name: T:LilyPath.DrawBatch
member.summary: Enables a group of figures to be drawn using the same settings.

remarks.para: Figures can be made up of primitive lines or paths stroked or filled into more complex polygon geometry.

When drawing paths with a thick pen and very short segments, such as closed arcs, you may encounter overdraw that is visible with semitransparent pens. You can avoid this overdraw by using an inset or outset on your pen, depending on the winding order of the path being stroked.

member.summary: Computes and adds a series of Bezier paths to the batch of figures to be rendered.
member.param: The pen to render the path with.
A list of Bezier points.
The type of Bezier curves to draw.

remarks.para: For quadratic Bezier curves, the number of points defined by the parameters should be a multiple of 2 plus 1 for open curves or 2 for closed curves. For cubic Bezier curves, the number of points defined by the parameters should be a multiple of 3 plus 1 for open curves or 3 for closed curves. For each curve drawn after the first, the ending point of the previous curve is used as the starting point. For closed curves, the end point of the last curve is the start point of the first curve.

member.name: T:LilyPath.ArcType
member.summary: The type of arc in closed drawing or fill operations.

member.name: F:LilyPath.ArcType.Segment
member.summary: Causes the endpoints of the arc to be connected directly.

member.name: F:LilyPath.ArcType.Sector
member.summary: Causes the endpoints of the arc to be connected to the arc center, as in a pie wedge.

member.name: T:LilyPath.BezierType
member.summary: The type of Bezier curve specified in draw operations.

member.name: F:LilyPath.BezierType.Quadratic
member.summary: Specifies a quadratic Bezier curve (1 control point).

member.name: F:LilyPath.BezierType.Cubic
member.summary: Specifies a cubic Bezier curve (2 control points).

member.name: T:LilyPath.LineCap
member.summary: The style of termination used at the endpoints of stroked paths.

member.name: F:LilyPath.LineCap.Flat
member.summary: The stroked path is cut off at the immediate edge of the path's endpoint.

member.name: F:LilyPath.LineCap.Square

For each curve drawn after the first, the ending point of the previous curve is used as the starting point.

member.summary: Gets or sets how the segments in the path are joined together.

member.name: P:LilyPath.Pen.MiterLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the limit of the thickness of the join on a mitered corner.

remarks.para: The miter length is the distance from the intersection of the line walls on the inside of the join to the intersection of the line walls outside of the join. The miter length can be large when the angle between two lines is small. The miter limit is the maximum allowed ratio of miter length to stroke width. The default value is 10.0f.
If the miter length of the join of the intersection exceeds the limit of the join, then the join will be beveled to keep it within the limit of the join of the intersection.

member.name: P:LilyPath.Pen.JoinLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle difference threshold in radians under which joins will be mitered instead of beveled or rounded. Defaults to PI / 8 (11.25 degrees).

member.summary: Gets or sets whether this pen "owns" the brush used to construct it, and should therefor dispose the brush along with itself.

member.name: P:LilyPath.Pen.NeedsPathLength
member.summary: Gets whether this pen needs path length values to properly calculate values at each sample point on the path.
